query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 La gloria di colui che tutto move 2 per l’universo penetra, e risplende 3 in una parte più e meno altrove.
query.result: 1 The glory of He who moves everything 2 through the universe penetrates, and shines 3 in one part more and less elsewhere.

4 In the sky that more of its light takes 5 I was, and saw things that to recount 6 neither knows nor can he who from there above descends;
7 because drawing near to its desire, 8 our intellect deepens so much, 9 that behind the memory it cannot go.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Veramente quant’ io del regno santo 11 ne la mia mente potei far tesoro, 12 sarà ora materia del mio canto.
query.result: 10 Truly as much as of the holy kingdom 11 in my mind I was able to make treasure, 12 will now be matter of my song.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 O buono Appollo, a l’ultimo lavoro 14 fammi del tuo valor sì fatto vaso, 15 come dimandi a dar l’amato alloro.
query.result: 13 O good Apollo, to the last work 14 make me of your power so made a vessel, 15 as you ask to give the beloved laurel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Infino a qui l’un giogo di Parnaso 17 assai mi fu; ma or con amendue 18 m’è uopo intrar ne l’aringo rimaso.
query.result: 16 Up to here the one yoke of Parnassus 17 was enough to me; but now with both 18 it is necessary to enter into the remaining arena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Entra nel petto mio, e spira tue 20 sì come quando Marsïa traesti 21 de la vagina de le membra sue.
query.result: 19 Enter into my breast, and breathe out yours 20 just as when Marsyas you drew out 21 from the hollow of his limbs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 O divina virtù, se mi ti presti 23 tanto che l’ombra del beato regno 24 segnata nel mio capo io manifesti,
25 vedra’mi al piè del tuo diletto legno 26 venire, e coronarmi de le foglie 27 che la materia e tu mi farai degno.
query.result:
22 O divine power, if you lend to me 23 so much that the shadow of the blessed kingdom 24 marked in my head I manifest,
25 I will see at the foot of your beloved ship 26 come, and crown myself with the leaves 27 that the material and you will make me worthy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Sì rade volte, padre, se ne coglie 29 per trïunfare o cesare o poeta, 30 colpa e vergogna de l’umane voglie,
31 che parturir letizia in su la lieta 32 delfica deïtà dovria la fronda 33 peneia, quando alcun di sé asseta.
query.result:
28 So rarely, father, is it gathered 29 to triumph or emperor or poet, 30 blame and shame of human desires,
31 that should bring forth joy on the happy 32 Delphic divinity, the foliage 33 Peneian, when anyone of himself thirsts.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Poca favilla gran fiamma seconda: 35 forse di retro a me con miglior voci 36 si pregherà perché Cirra risponda.
query.result: 34 Little spark, great flame follows: 35 perhaps behind me with better voices 36 it will be prayed that Cirrha responds.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Surge ai mortali per diverse foci 38 la lucerna del mondo; ma da quella 39 che quattro cerchi giugne con tre croci,
40 con miglior corso e con migliore stella 41 esce congiunta, e la mondana cera 42 più a suo modo tempera e suggella.
query.result:
37 Rises to mortals through different openings 38 the lamp of the world; but from that one 39 that four circles joins with three crosses,
40 with better course and with better star 41 it comes forth united, and the worldly wax 42 more to its manner tempers and seals.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Fatto avea di là mane e di qua sera 44 tal foce, e quasi tutto era là bianco 45 quello emisperio, e l’altra parte nera,
46 quando Beatrice in sul sinistro fianco 47 vidi rivolta e riguardar nel sole: 48 aguglia sì non li s’affisse unquanco.
query.result:
43 Had made of there morning and of here evening 44 such opening, and almost all was there white 45 that hemisphere, and the other part black,
46 when Beatrice on the left side 47 I saw turned and looking into the sun: 48 a needle never fixed itself so quickly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 E sì come secondo raggio suole 50 uscir del primo e risalire in suso, 51 pur come pelegrin che tornar vuole,
52 così de l’atto suo, per li occhi infuso 53 ne l’imagine mia, il mio si fece, 54 e fissi li occhi al sole oltre nostr’ uso.
query.result:
49 And just as a second ray usually 50 comes forth from the first and rises upwards, 51 just like a pilgrim who wants to return,
52 thus from her act, through the eyes infused 53 into my image, mine became, 54 and I fixed my eyes on the sun beyond our use.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Molto è licito là, che qui non lece 56 a le nostre virtù, mercé del loco 57 fatto per proprio de l’umana spece.
query.result: 55 Much is permitted there, that here does not permit 56 to our virtues, by grace of the place 57 made proper for the human species.

58 I did not endure it much, nor so little, 59 that I did not see it sparkle around, 60 like iron that boiling comes forth from the fire;
61 and suddenly it seemed day to day 62 to be added, as those who could 63 had the sky adorned with another sun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Beatrice tutta ne l’etterne rote 65 fissa con li occhi stava; e io in lei 66 le luci fissi, di là sù rimote.
query.result: 64 Beatrice all in the eternal circles 65 fixed with her eyes was; and I in her 66 the lights fixed, from up there remote.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Nel suo aspetto tal dentro mi fei, 68 qual si fé Glauco nel gustar de l’erba 69 che ’l fé consorto in mar de li altri dèi.
query.result: 67 In her appearance so within me made, 68 as Glaucus became when tasting the herb 69 that made him companion in the sea of the other gods.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Trasumanar significar per verba 71 non si poria; però l’essemplo basti 72 a cui esperïenza grazia serba.
query.result: 70 To transhuman signify through words 71 would not be possible; therefore let the example suffice 72 to which experience keeps grace.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 S’i’ era sol di me quel che creasti 74 novellamente, amor che ’l ciel governi, 75 tu ’l sai, che col tuo lume mi levasti.
query.result: 73 If it was only of me that you created 74 newly, love that governs the heavens, 75 you know that with your light you raised me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Quando la rota che tu sempiterni 77 desiderato, a sé mi fece atteso 78 con l’armonia che temperi e discerni,
79 parvemi tanto allor del cielo acceso 80 de la fiamma del sol, che pioggia o fiume 81 lago non fece alcun tanto disteso.
query.result:
76 When the wheel that you eternally 77 desired, made me attentive to itself 78 with the harmony that you temper and discern,
79 it seemed to me so much then of the sky lit 80 by the flame of the sun, that rain or river 81 lake made none so extended.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 La novità del suono e ’l grande lume 83 di lor cagion m’accesero un disio 84 mai non sentito di cotanto acume.
query.result: 82 The novelty of the sound and the great light 83 from their cause ignited in me a desire 84 never felt of so much keenness.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Ond’ ella, che vedea me sì com’ io, 86 a quïetarmi l’animo commosso, 87 pria ch’io a dimandar, la bocca aprio
88 e cominciò: «Tu stesso ti fai grosso 89 col falso imaginar, sì che non vedi 90 ciò che vedresti se l’avessi scosso.
query.result:
85 And she, who saw me as I was, 86 to quiet my moved soul, 87 before I asked, opened her mouth
88 and began: “You yourself make it large 89 with false imagining, so that you do not see 90 what you would see if you had shaken it off.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Tu non se’ in terra, sì come tu credi; 92 ma folgore, fuggendo il proprio sito, 93 non corse come tu ch’ad esso riedi».

Please translate each line literally into English.
94 S’io fui del primo dubbio disvestito 95 per le sorrise parolette brevi, 96 dentro ad un nuovo più fu’ inretito
97 e dissi: «Già contento requïevi 98 di grande ammirazion; ma ora ammiro 99 com’ io trascenda questi corpi levi».
query.result:
94 If I was stripped of the first doubt 95 by the smiling short words, 96 within a new one I was more entangled.
97 And I said: “Already content you rested 98 with great admiration; but now I admire 99 how I transcend these light bodies.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Ond’ ella, appresso d’un pïo sospiro, 101 li occhi drizzò ver’ me con quel sembiante 102 che madre fa sovra figlio deliro,
103 e cominciò: «Le cose tutte quante 104 hanno ordine tra loro, e questo è forma 105 che l’universo a Dio fa simigliante.
query.result:
100 And she, after a pious sigh, 101 directed her eyes towards me with that appearance 102 that a mother makes over a delirious son,
103 and began: “All things 104 have order among themselves, and this is a form 105 that makes the universe similar to God.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Qui veggion l’alte creature l’orma 107 de l’etterno valore, il qual è fine 108 al quale è fatta la toccata norma.
query.result: 106 Here the high creatures see the imprint 107 of the eternal value, which is the end 108 to which the touched norm is made.

109 In the order that I say are inclined 110 all natures, through different fates, 111 more to their beginning and less close;
112 whence they move to different ports 113 through the great sea of being, and each one 114 with instinct given to it that carries it.

121 Providence, which sets all this up, 122 with its light makes the heaven always quiet 123 in which revolves what has the greatest haste;
124 and now there, as to a decreed place, 125 she carries the virtue of that string 126 that straightens what she shoots in a joyful sign.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Vero è che, come forma non s’accorda 128 molte fïate a l’intenzion de l’arte, 129 perch’ a risponder la materia è sorda,
130 così da questo corso si diparte 131 talor la creatura, c’ha podere 132 di piegar, così pinta, in altra parte;
133 e sì come veder si può cadere 134 foco di nube, sì l’impeto primo 135 l’atterra torto da falso piacere.

Please translate each line literally into English.
136 Non dei più ammirar, se bene stimo, 137 lo tuo salir, se non come d’un rivo 138 se d’alto monte scende giuso ad imo.
query.result: 136 Do not more admire, if well I esteem, 137 your ascent, if not as of a river 138 that from high mountain descends down to low.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Maraviglia sarebbe in te se, privo 140 d’impedimento, giù ti fossi assiso, 141 com’ a terra quïete in foco vivo».
query.result: 139 Wonder it would be in you if, free 140 of impediment, down you had sat, 141 as on earth quiet in living fire.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
142 Quinci rivolse inver’ lo cielo il viso.
query.result: 142 Thence he turned towards the sky the face.
